docs.lead_paragraph: Among the 130 victims killed in attacks in Paris were students, a filmmaker, a doctor, artists, music lovers and beloved parents and children. They had varied backgrounds and interests. Here are some of their stories:

headline.main: Coke’s Chief Scientist, Who Orchestrated Obesity Research, Is Leaving
headline.print_headline: Coca-Cola’s Top Scientist on Obesity Is Departing

docs.abstract: Rhona Applebaum, Coca-Cola’s top scientist, is stepping down, a move that follows revelations that the company had funded research that played down the role beverages played in the spread of obesity.
docs.snippet: Rhona Applebaum, Coca-Cola’s top scientist, is stepping down, a move that follows revelations that the company had funded research that played down the role beverages played in the spread of obesity.

docs.lead_paragraph: A nonprofit founded to fight obesity says the $1.5 million it received from Coke doesn't influence its work. But emails obtained by The Associated Press show the company was instrumental in shaping the group.

headline.main: Excerpts From Emails Between Coke, Anti-Obesity Group
headline.print_headline: Excerpts From Emails Between Coke, Anti-Obesity Group

docs.snippet: A nonprofit founded to fight obesity says the $1.5 million it received from Coke doesn't influence its work. But emails obtained by The Associated Press show the company was instrumental in shaping the group.

headline.main: Video Game Is Built to Be Prescribed to Children With A.D.H.D.

docs.abstract: A game maker plans to seek approval from the Food and Drug Administration to allow doctors to prescribe its game to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.
docs.snippet: A game maker plans to seek approval from the Food and Drug Administration to allow doctors to prescribe its game to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

docs.lead_paragraph: State wildlife biologists say the hunt in the Blue Hills Reservation is needed to reduce a deer population far above the ideal; animal activists insist on contraception and other nonlethal methods.

headline.main: Deer Hunt to Thin Herd Near Boston Is Criticized
headline.print_headline: Deer Hunt to Thin Herd Near Boston Is Criticized

docs.abstract: Plan to allow deer hunting near downtown Boston is decried by activists and citizens, who argue burgeoning deer population should be reduced by non-lethal means; civic officials claim hunt is cheaper and more effective way to avoid potential ecological distress than contraception and sterilization.
docs.snippet: State wildlife biologists say the hunt in the Blue Hills Reservation is needed to reduce a deer population far above the ideal; animal activists insist on contraception and other nonlethal methods.

docs.lead_paragraph: Both groups said that the United Nations health agency’s outbreak and emergency response capacities should be strengthened, and protected from political meddling.

headline.main: Panels Advise Bolstering W.H.O. for Crises Like Ebola
headline.print_headline: Panels Advise Bolstering W.H.O. for Crises Like Ebola

docs.abstract: Health experts convened by World Health Organization release guidelines for responding to global health crises, after West African Ebola epidemic which killed over 11,000 people; panel asserts United Nations-affiliated WHO should be protected from political influence by independent overseer, and have its capacities streamlined and strengthened.
docs.snippet: Both groups said that the United Nations health agency’s outbreak and emergency response capacities should be strengthened, and protected from political meddling.

docs.lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization's failure to sound the alarm until months into West Africa's Ebola outbreak was an "egregious failure" which added to the enormous suffering and death toll, global health experts said on Monday.

headline.main: Global Health Experts Accuse WHO of 'Egregious Failure' on Ebola
headline.print_headline: Global Health Experts Accuse WHO of 'Egregious Failure' on Ebola

docs.snippet: The World Health Organization's failure to sound the alarm until months into West Africa's Ebola outbreak was an "egregious failure" which added to the enormous suffering and death toll, global health experts said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A plan to allow hunting in a nearly 11-square-mile swath of pristine forest within sight of downtown Boston to thin the exploding deer population is coming under fire from activists who insist that contraception and other more humane methods be used.

headline.main: Deer Hunt in Massachusetts Recreational Area Sparks Backlash
headline.print_headline: Deer Hunt in Massachusetts Recreational Area Sparks Backlash

docs.snippet: A plan to allow hunting in a nearly 11-square-mile swath of pristine forest within sight of downtown Boston to thin the exploding deer population is coming under fire from activists who insist that contraception and other more humane methods be used.
